0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify the accuracy of commercial invoices, bills of lading, and other trade documents to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
Arrange for the pre-arrival clearance of shipments by communicating with relevant authorities and suppliers.
Conduct research on market trends and changes in regulations to provide valuable insights to clients.
Prepare and submit export documentation, including certificates of origin and phytosanitary certificates.
Coordinate with shipping lines, airlines, and logistics providers to ensure timely delivery of goods.
Negotiate with suppliers and clients to resolve discrepancies and issues related to customs clearance.
Develop and maintain relationships with clients, vendors, and industry partners to drive business growth.
Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards by staying up-to-date on changes and updates.
Facilitate communication between clients, suppliers, and government agencies to resolve customs-related issues.
Conduct inspections of shipments to ensure compliance with export regulations and company policies.
Obtain necessary licenses and permits for the importation and exportation of goods.
Create and manage customer databases to track shipments, documents, and other relevant information.
Respond promptly to inquiries from clients, suppliers, and government agencies regarding customs-related issues.
Collaborate with colleagues to resolve complex customs clearance issues and share best practices.
Prepare presentations and reports to present to clients and stakeholders on customs clearance options and benefits.
Monitor market conditions and adjust business strategies accordingly to stay competitive in the industry.
Ensure accurate recording of shipment details, including weight, value, and description, for tax purposes.
Attend seminars, workshops, and conferences to expand knowledge and network with industry professionals.
Manage relationships with government agencies, regulatory bodies, and trade organizations to ensure compliance with regulations.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information in accordance with company policies and data protection laws.
Participate in the development of new business strategies, including identifying potential opportunities for expansion and growth.
1: Develop and implement comprehensive training programs for employees to improve job skills and productivity.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and create customized learning plans.
Design, deliver, and evaluate training sessions on various topics, including leadership development and technical skills.
Coordinate logistics for workshops, conferences, and other training events, ensuring timely registration and accommodation arrangements.
Create engaging training materials, such as e-learning modules, video tutorials, and instructor-led guides.
Manage training budgets, track expenses, and provide reports to stakeholders on training effectiveness.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop and deliver specialized training programs in areas like IT, sales, or compliance.
Assess the impact of training initiatives and measure their return on investment (ROI) through data analysis and metrics.
Create employee onboarding programs that integrate new hires into the organization's culture and policies.
Establish partnerships with external training providers to offer employees access to specialized skills development opportunities.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to inform training content and strategy.
2: Prepare meals according to recipes and nutritional guidelines, ensuring food safety and presentation standards.
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health and sanitation regulations.
Receive and store incoming ingredients and supplies in designated areas, verifying quantities and expiration dates.
Assist with menu planning and cost control, minimizing waste and optimizing inventory management.
Prepare side dishes, salads, and garnishes for main course presentation, considering dietary restrictions and allergies.
Monitor food temperatures during cooking and holding, adhering to safe internal temperatures for various food groups.
Operate kitchen equipment, including ovens, stoves, and dishwashers, following safety protocols and manufacturer guidelines.
Coordinate with servers and management to ensure timely service of meals, meeting customer satisfaction standards.
Maintain accurate records of inventory, ordering, and waste disposal, contributing to efficient supply chain management.
Conduct quality control checks on prepared dishes, identifying areas for improvement and suggesting modifications as needed.
Follow proper food handling and safety procedures during storage, transportation, and preparation, protecting against cross-contamination and foodborne illness.
Wash and sanitize utensils, equipment, and kitchen surfaces, adhering to established cleaning schedules and protocols.
